Title:
Two new endophytic species of Phyllosticta (Phyllostictaceae,
Botryosphaeriales) from Southern China
Abstract:
Phyllosticta is an important phytopathogenic genus known
to cause various leaf spots and fruit diseases worldwide on a large
range of hosts. Two new species of Phyllosticta (P. dendrobii and P.
illicii) are described and illustrated from Dendrobium nobile and
Illicium verum in China. Phylogenetic analysis based on combined ITS,
LSU, TEF, ACT and GPDH loci supported its separation from other species
of Phyllosticta. Morphologically, P. dendrobii is most comparable with
P. aplectri, while the large-sized pycnidia of P. dendrobii
differentiate it from P. aplectri. Members of Phyllosticta are first
reported from Dendrobium and Illicium.
